intro: Adenostemma mauritianum, commonly known as the Mauritius star grass, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a radiate head. Adenostemma mauritianum plays a role in stabilizing dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
